did.physloc: Building: Bobst Area: Cage Aisle: 5 Range: D Shelf: 4

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Tuli Kupferberg (September 28, 1923 - 2010) was a poet, author, cartoonist, anarchist, publisher and co-founder of the band The Fugs. In 1958 he founded the magazine Birth which, despite running for only three issues, published many notable authors from the Beat Generation such as Allen Ginsberg, Diane Di Prima, LeRoi Jones and Ted Joans.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain 120 years after the date of their creation. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of cartoons, graphics, posters, songs and other documents relating to labor and the left, collected and authored by Kupferberg.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Provenance is unknown; the accession number associated with this collection is 1950.245. Various cartoons collected and authored by Kupferberg were found in repository in April 2014 and were added to this collection. The accession number associated with this material is: 2014.074.
